issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

Where, this should be only shown in the case of EBS backed images.
fields.summary: euca-describe-images shows account ID instead of bucket name for instance-store backed images
fields.environment:
Name        : euca2ools
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.0.2
Release     : 0.0.123.20131011gitd640f7f9.el6
Size        : 1.5 M
Repo        : installed

comments.body: It depends on the whether the image has a name or not, if it has a name, it will show {{<account id>/<image name>}}, if it does not have a name, it will show the image location.

Issue is present when using instance store-backed HVM EMIs on Eucalyptus 4.0.0 - 4.0.0-0.0.867.20140411git0cd00881.el6.x86_64:

{code}
[root@odc-d-31 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-2d8fd091
IMAGE	emi-2d8fd091	408181979667/trusty-x86_64-hvm	408181979667	available	private	x86_64	machine				instance-store	hvm
{code}

Per AWS behavior, account ID for buckets should show for EBS-backed images only.  Instance store-backed images (paravirt or HVM) still have the bucket name showing.  Here is the example for all the [Ubuntu 13.10 Cloud Images|http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/saucy/current/] on AWS in us-east-1 AZ:
{code}
euca-prod-1-82:~ haroldspencerjr$ aws ec2 describe-images --image-ids ami-ef0e1286 ami-b30e12da  ami-2b170b42 ami-871804ee --profile harold-work --output text

## 64-bit hvm-instance ##

IMAGES	x86_64	xen	ami-2b170b42	ubuntu-us-east-1/images-testing/hvm-instance/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1.manifest.xml	machine		ubuntu/images-testing/hvm-instance/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1	099720109477	True		instance-store	available	hvm

## 64-bit instance ##

IMAGES	x86_64	xen	ami-871804ee	ubuntu-us-east-1/images-testing/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1.manifest.xml	machine	aki-919dcaf8	ubuntu/images-testing/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1	099720109477	True		instance-store	available	paravirtual

## 64-bit hvm ##

IMAGES	x86_64	xen	ami-b30e12da	099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/hvm/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1	machine		ubuntu/images-testing/hvm/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1	099720109477	True	/dev/sda1	ebs	available	hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sda1
EBS	True	snap-f31ba32e	8	standard
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sdb	ephemeral0
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sdc	ephemeral1

## 64-bit ebs ##

IMAGES	x86_64	xen	ami-ef0e1286	099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1	machine	aki-919dcaf8	ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-saucy-daily-amd64-server-20140409.1	099720109477	True	/dev/sda1	ebs	available	paravirtual
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sda1
EBS	True	snap-60348cbd	8	standard
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sdb	ephemeral0
{code}

Output in my environment looks good:

[root@g-26-05 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-36a2376c
IMAGE	emi-36a2376c	cc-ubuntu-01/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml	649208974866	available	private	x86_64	machine				instance-store	hvm
